intro: Galium ceratophylloides, commonly known as the horned bedstraw, is a perennial herb belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and stream banks. Galium ceratophylloides is typically found in temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia.
